comment.body:
### Review Checklist

Hello reviewers! :wave: Please follow this checklist when reviewing this Pull Request.

#### General
- [ ] Ensure that the Pull Request has a descriptive title.
- [ ] Ensure there is a link to an issue (except for internal cleanup and flaky test fixes), new features should have an RFC that documents use cases and test cases.

#### Tests
- [ ] Bug fixes should have at least one unit or end-to-end test, enhancement and new features should have a sufficient number of tests.

#### Documentation
- [ ] Apply the `release notes (needs details)` label if users need to know about this change.
- [ ] New features should be documented.
- [ ] There should be some code comments as to why things are implemented the way they are.
- [ ] There should be a comment at the top of each new or modified test to explain what the test does.

#### New flags
- [ ] Is this flag really necessary?
- [ ] Flag names must be clear and intuitive, use dashes (`-`), and have a clear help text.

#### If a workflow is added or modified:
- [ ] Each item in `Jobs` should be named in order to mark it as `required`.
- [ ] If the workflow needs to be marked as `required`, the maintainer team must be notified.

#### Backward compatibility
- [ ] Protobuf changes should be wire-compatible.
- [ ] Changes to `_vt` tables and RPCs need to be backward compatible.
- [ ] RPC changes should be compatible with vitess-operator
- [ ] If a flag is removed, then it should also be removed from [vitess-operator](https://github.com/planetscale/vitess-operator) and [arewefastyet](https://github.com/vitessio/arewefastyet), if used there.
- [ ] `vtctl` command output order should be stable and `awk`-able.

issue.title: VDiff: vttablet panics for vdiffs with multiple tables under heavy load
issue.body:
### Overview of the Issue

There is a race condition in VDiff when a workflow has multiple tables. Consider a workflow with two tables.
1. The diff of the first table is deemed done, because too many rows have errors, for example. The corresponding shard streamers are waiting on cancellation of the context passed into vdiff (which times out on `action_timeout` (1 hour) or on the controller's context cancellation which happens when the entire vdiff (for all tables) is done.
2. The second table's diff starts. This does creates a new channel `source.result = make(chan *sqltypes.Result, 1)` for the shard streamers to communicate their rows on.
3. The second table's diff ends. The corresponding shard streamers for the second table are also waiting on the same conditions as the first table.
4. Since all tables have completed vdiff the controller's context is done and both sets of shard streamers try to `close(source.result)`, which is pointing to the same channel due to the race.
5. This results in a vttablet panic for the second streamer.


The race which I encountered happened under conditions of load where there was a load simulator running DMLs at ~1K QPS.

### Reproduction Steps

Happened while working on https://github.com/vitessio/vitess/pull/14345

### Binary Version

```sh
v19
```

pull_request.title: VDiff: wait for shard streams of one table diff to complete for before starting that of the next table
pull_request.body:
## Description

While working on https://github.com/vitessio/vitess/pull/14327, I experienced repeatable panics while running vdiffs on the workflows which had two tables. The second vdiff would be initialized before the first one ended, resulting in the channel used to synchronize results to be overwritten  by the second vdiff before it was cancelled by the first one. 

This PR adds synchronization so that the context in which the shard streams run to be cancelled when a table's differ is deemed complete, and the vdiff waits for these streams to complete before proceeding.

In addition there was a separate error while saving the error state in the vdiff record. The error contained gtids which can be arbitrarily large. The PR also limits the size of the error being recorded.

## Related Issue(s)

  - Fixes: https://github.com/vitessio/vitess/issues/14346

## Checklist

-   [X] "Backport to:" labels have been added if this change should be back-ported
-   [x] Test for this is in: https://github.com/vitessio/vitess/pull/14327
-   [x] Did the new or modified tests pass consistently locally and on the CI
-   [x] Documentation was added or is not required
